channel.title: [PI] Converting this to arrays or enums

item.title: [PI] Converting this to arrays or enums
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

If it’s inside the method it gets declared every time the method is called instead of just once when the class is instantiated. You’re just wasting processing time and memory by doing it that way.

However, it should still be just final, not public static.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Converting this to arrays or enums

item.title: [PI] Converting this to arrays or enums
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

The array AtomicInt posted is inside the method, it should NOT be there. Put the final array outside of the code block, with the rest of the variable declarations.

item.title: [PI] Converting this to arrays or enums
item.dc:creator: @pker235 pker235
item.description:
@pker235 wrote:

public void applyDamage(int i) {
		
		if(npcs[i] != null) {
			if(Server.playerHandler.players[npcs[i].oldIndex] == null) {
				return;
			}
			
			if (npcs[i].isDead)
				return;
			Client c = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[npcs[i].oldIndex];
			if (multiAttacks(i)) {
				multiAttackDamage(i);
				return;
			}
			 c.getPA().handleDegrade(c, damage);
			if (c.playerIndex <= 0 && c.npcIndex <= 0)
				if (c.autoRet == 1)
					c.npcIndex = i;
			if(c.attackTimer <= 3 || c.attackTimer == 0 && c.npcIndex == 0 && c.oldNpcIndex == 0) {
				c.startAnimation(c.getCombat().getBlockEmote());
			}
			if(c.respawnTimer <= 0) {	
				int damage = 0;
				if(npcs[i].attackType == 0) {
					damage = Misc.random(npcs[i].maxHit);
					if (10 + Misc.random(c.getCombat().calculateMeleeDefence()) > Misc.random(Server.npcHandler.npcs[i].attack)) {
						damage = 0;
					}

A part of it since the method is so huge.
http://pastebin.com/SM3TaV2C is the full method.

item.title: [PI] Converting this to arrays or enums
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

That’s all of it? Alright.

	public static void handleDegrade(final Player player, final int damage) {
	    final int[] DEGRADEABLES = {
		/* Armor */
		13884, 13858, 13887, 13870,
		/* Legs */
		13873, 13893, 13861, 13890,
		/* Helmets */
		13896, 13876, 13864,
		/* Weapons */
		13867, 13902, 13899, 13905
	    };
	    for (final int degradeables : DEGRADEABLES) {
		for (int i = 0; i < player.playerEquipment.length; ++i) {
		    if (player.playerEquipment[i] == degradeables) {
			if ((Misc.random(320) == 1) && (damage > 0)) {
			    player.getItems().removeItem(player.playerEquipment[i], i);
			    player.getItems().deleteItem(degradeables, player.getItems().getItemSlot(degradeables), 1);
			}
		    }
		}
		player.sendMessage("Your " + player.getItems().getItemName(degradeables) + " has degraded to dust.");
	    }
	}

This should work, only did it by memory.

You may need to change the Player parameter to Client.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Converting this to arrays or enums
item.dc:creator: @pker235 pker235
item.description:
@pker235 wrote:

if ((c.playerEquipment[4] == 13887)) { //vesta plate
   if (Misc.random(320) == 1 && damage > 0) {
   c.getItems().removeItem(c.playerEquipment[4], 4);
   c.getItems().deleteItem(13887, c.getItems().getItemSlot(13887), 1);
   c.sendMessage("Your Vesta's Chainbody degrades.");
   }
   }
   if ((c.playerEquipment[3] == 13899)) { //vesta sword
   if (Misc.random(320) == 1 && damage > 0) {
   c.getItems().removeItem(c.playerEquipment[3], 3);
   c.getItems().deleteItem(13887, c.getItems().getItemSlot(13887), 1);
   c.sendMessage("Your Vesta's Longsword degrades.");
   }
   }
   if ((c.playerEquipment[7] == 13893)) { //vesta plateskirt
   if (Misc.random(320) == 1 && damage > 0) {
   c.getItems().removeItem(c.playerEquipment[7], 7);
   c.getItems().deleteItem(13893, c.getItems().getItemSlot(13893), 1);
   c.sendMessage("Your Vesta's Plateskirt degrades.");
   }
   }

I want to convert this ugly ass code into 1 simple array or enum that calls each item instead of making a new if statement for each item. I made an array for it, but not sure what to continue with it.

public int[]pvpArmour = {13884, 13858, 13887, 13870}; public int[]pvpLegs = {13873, 13893, 13861, 13890}; public int[]pvpHelm = {13896, 13876, 13864}; public int[]pvpWeapons = {13867, 13902, 13899, 13905};
